caption: Great stadium tour. You can touch to locker room, place for recovery and massages and all infrastructure accompanying the stadium. Also you can watch a short movie about history of the PSG. You can do same activities behind the goal. I definitely recommend visiting.

Amazing experience to watch the local team play and win. I sat with the local team to cheer and enjoyed very much the goal celebrations !  Goals of Mbappe and Messi ! I could not ask for more ! üòÅ The stadium has very easy to follow instructions from the purchase of your ticket to reach your seat. When you reach your seat,  you find flag of the local team. Great experience. Highly recommended.
Paris Saint Germain Feminines against Olympique Lyon on 18th January 2025 ; amazing atmosphere and lovely people
We went on a tour in the stadium it was magical to be in there it‚Äôs really worth it and we got some jerseys and hoodies on the way out but over all it‚Äôs worth it and it‚Äôs nice for kids also
Worth going for two hours max. Prices were cheap. Lots to see. Awsome for football/soccer fanatics.

Quite impressive to see close up however looks old compared to the new stadiums you now see around Really easy to access with Metro stations close by and an absolutely excellent club shop attached Also Paris SF rugby stadium next door which is also worth seeing

Son had a great time exploring the stadium. We booked tickets that morning, without any trouble, ‚Ç¨30 each. No tour guide but there is a short film in the press room that tells you all you need to know. Allowed to take your time looking around and taking photos.
Great visit. Worth to see the inside of the Parc des Princes.

Feeling the energy of Parc des Princes was like stepping back in time to the legendary stadiums of South America. The passionate home crowd creates an intense atmosphere that can rattle even the most experienced visiting teams. I had the privilege of witnessing this first-hand during the Olympics, surrounded by the vibrant Moroccan fans. It was an unforgettable experience.

Coming from the UK, this was a special treat for my teenage son being a huge fan of Paris Saint Germain fc. He loved every second of it. I loved the freedom of the tour. The stadium was very impressive. Of course we had to visit the stadium shop.

It has always been a dream to visit a football stadium in Europe and this brought out the child in me. From walking the halls, visiting the locker room and getting to go on the pitch, it‚Äôs more than one can ask for. The store made it even better. I would definitely go back and I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Paris

Incredible venue. Didn‚Äôt do the tour but recommend looking at home games. Fairly reasonable prices to see world class athletes. The train to the city also made transportation easy. Carefully because they require a deposit for the plastic cup. Just makes it easier to keep things clean.

The start of the stadium tour extremely unorganised, with no set signs saying where to go, like a free for all to get in, no matter if you had pre booked.. due to the free for all, the start of the tour is extremely crowded. Once you get past the crowd the tour was good, unaccompanied around and get full access.

Came here in February 2023 for a Champions League match up, Bayern Munich vs Paris St Germain.  To get into the stadium took a really long time, really good security system but definitely took like 45 minutes from the metro to going inside.  Depending on which section you are in, there are separate gates to go into and you have to go all the way around.  Lots of residential areas around as well.  Lots of queues but yes, very safe.  I did not buy any food or anything but nice buzz to the arena when it is a Champions League night.  Wish I could have explored a bit more but I was pressed on time.

I have reserved via website and you will do the tour by yourself. There are signs which you will follow and look around the stadium. It is good that you can visit players‚Äô lounge, media room, vip room, sky box, interview zones and almost every places inside the stadium

Visiting this place was one of the best experiences i had in Paris. Security was agreeable , situation was calm every and everything was comfortable , there‚Äôs even cafeteria if you get hungry and they have super delicious cheeseburger, i LOOVED it. The match was very interesting and i had good time attendance. I can‚Äôt t wait to go back !

Fantastic well worth the money! It was for my boys I'm not really a football fan but really enjoyed the whole tour. Staff were very friendly and my boys said it was the highlight to our holiday. Will definitely return.

The Tour was independently to be carried out. I would have liked it more if a little bit of story telling would be part of. The movie explained, but was not really inspiring. But a nice Tour of around 1h10... After you can go to the PSG Shop on the other site of the road.

My nephew loved it! I thought it would be a guided tour, but it ended up being a self-guided tour. Nevertheless, he was plenty impressed, especially with the changing rooms. The little video half way through in the history of the PSG was a nice touch. There were A LOT of stairs so it might not be for people with mobility issues. (I don't actually know whether there were elevators.)
It was a game day, so it was closed but the vibe is superb.
Beautiful stadium! psg fans are great! Good üç∫beer ‚Ä¶

Totally unspectacular stadium, on a par with an English Championship stadium. The tour is underwhelming with no tour guides, to share information or anecdotes. I would give it a miss, just look at photos, plenty of other wonderful things to do in Paris.

Great stadium tour. Vert well organized. My football lover son enjoyed a lot. We visited many part of the stadium. It was not a guided tour but all the steps were organized well. We also had a questionnaire to fill and my son got 2 players carss at the end. Its better to book in advance and reach there in advance. There is also a shop next to it.

Actually really loved this tour. My daughter and husband are big soccer fans and since Messi played for PSG, of course we had to go while we were in Paris. It was really cool! Coming from the US, I loved seeing what an amazing stadium they had for soccer. The grass!!! Wow!! They were prepping for a game and it was beautiful. The mascot was walking around taking pics, which was really neat. And the store! Huge! You can buy a jersey and for an extra 25Euro put your own name and number on the back. Pretty spendy, but a very unique souvenir. Definitely recommend.
The stadium and staff were really good, but they didnt have too many attractions. The only cool things to do were visiting the locker rooms and the pitch. It was a good experience though.
Looking at it for the first was impressive.. with the local official store being well organized. I did enjoy shopping here!!

One of the best football stadiums I‚Äôve ever been to! I‚Äôve been to over 100 different stadiums around the UK and a few in Europe and nothing beats this ground for atmosphere.  Security was very tight but felt at ease with how good they all were. Tickets are checked several times before you enter and you‚Äôre also checked on entry.  Drink prices are fair and you can even buy your own PSG plastic cups and you can keep them and take them home with you(‚Ç¨6 for a Coke and a PSG cup)  The only downside was lack of space with the seats in the stadium and the fact they don‚Äôt sell football programmes.  If you love football, this would be an amazing experience for you! It‚Äôs a must go to place if you ever visit Paris.

My family and I went on the PSG stadium tour today. The stadium itself is nice to look at and the tour is self guided so you can move through it at your own pace. There were lots of stairs and escalators so not sure how easy someone in a wheelchair would find it. This is an incredibly popular tour so expect hundreds of others to be on the tour with you.
@AfterHoursCupping Self guided stadium tour was good and easy to follow
Amazing atmoshpere, expensive but worth it once in a lifetime. It was the best game ever with a 5-0 win and a beautiful volley from Mbapp√©.

My son & I toured the stadium.  It was awesome.  We got to walk through lots of areas inside the stadium & on the pitch. Toward the end of the tour there‚Äôs a goal set up & you can take a shot! So cool! We also got the chance to see PSG play a Champions League match!  Before you get onto the football grounds, there is a quick ticket check & only ticket holders can go to the stadium.  There were quite a few food trucks & there was also a dj.  The pre game atmosphere was so awesome.  There was a PSG cut out photo opportunity where stadium staff offered to take pictures of us.  There was also a young lady giving out badges of the game. Getting into the stadium was really easy.  Once your scan your ticket & go through the gate, security pats you down.  My only issue is that there was one female security guard and 3 men. So my son had to wait 15/20 mins because there was a long line of females waiting.  We stopped to grab a drink & some popcorn.  The drinks were served in commemorative souvenir cups.  The prices are reasonable. There are plenty of stadium staff who were able to quickly get us to our seats. The atmosphere at this stadium was magical.  I was so happy & proud to be part of it!  Everyone at the stadium was buzzing.  The chants are easy to learn & the fans around you will help if you need! I can‚Äôt wait to go back & watch another PSG match!

Nice tour. You get to see a lot of the stadium. However, there is no guidance or information as it is just a self guided tour. On the plus side, you can stay for as long as you want and take as many pictures as you want. There is a PSG store across the street.

One of the most underwhelming tours I've been to; the stadium itself is great, it's neat, new-looking and is well kept. The tour is unguided and forces you do download their app, register and give them your personal details (regardless of whether you're a fan of not) to make use of the audio guide.  The cost versus what been made available to see isn't worth it; much less than most (even when compared to much smaller clubs' stadium tours.  Not worth the money.
Beautiful park. We did the self guided tour. Was so glad we were able to kick a ball into the net.

As a fan myself I enjoyed it alot. There were many things to see and to experience. Only thing I disliked was that there were no signs for you to get to know something about the stadium or rooms you were visiting. F. e. figuring out what the rooms were that you were in. It was quite crowded, so I recommend getting a ticket for very early. Otherwise you could take nice pictures and you could watch a short video in a press room.

I love how this stadium is inmerse in the city. The public transportation was great and we were able to get to the stadium on time. The ticket entrance could be definitely better but once you pass those gates it's straight to your seat.  We loved the Champions League atmosphere although the price for each ticket is really high compared to other tickets in Europe.  Worth it? I guess it is if this is a one time purchase, otherwise, if you are planning on going several times I wouldn't think it is that worth it.

A couple caveats to this review: -PSG Supporters Groups were banned from the game I attended due to questionable behaviour earlier. Their stands were entirely empty. -My seats were knowingly purchased with a restricted view.  After four to five security checks, it was nice to experience a game at Parc des Princes. Amenities are slim, and the stadium is pretty basic, but you can tell the fans love this team immensely. I‚Äôd vote on replacing the stadium though, as the roof was actually leaking in the area we were seated. Not a great look.  Mixed pleasantness from staff. Not much in terms of food. Decent atmosphere. Not bad!

Great experience at the stadium tour! The stadium is quite underwhelming from the outside and is a bit basic inside too, but the actual football pitch is amazing - I could just sit there and look at it for hours! Would recommend a visit.
